summary: This bill, the TRUTH in Labeling Act, mandates strengthened requirements for front-of-package nutrition labeling on food products. It directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to finalize a proposed rule requiring labels to highlight high amounts of added sugars, sodium, and saturated fat, using Daily Reference Values for different age groups. It also requires the disclosure of non-nutritive sweeteners and an advisory against their consumption by children. The bill aims to improve consumer understanding of food healthfulness and encourage healthier choices.
